result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik C Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Apply 1 day sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the co-actor (J. N.) listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at the agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Erik C Olson in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  
Jury Trail Cancelled.

State moves to amend the charge to Possession of Narcotics.
Defense has no objections.
Amended Information filed.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Defendant's father presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
1 Day Credit - IF REVOKED.
 
Term of Probation: 1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Co-Actor (J.N.) listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.

Costs:   $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Letter dated March 23, 2017 filed by W.C.S. requesting the court remove the bond condition of complying with W.C.S.  so that they are able to serve higher risk defendant.

3/27/17 - Court reviewed and ordered the following: Court granted WCS request to remove WCS as a bail condition.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Erik C Olson in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  
Motion filed by the Defense - Suppression of Consent to Search.

Witnesses Called:  Officer James Wolbert (City of Waukesha Police Department) and Officer Heather Doud (City of Waukesha Police Department).
All witnesses sworn and testified.

Testimony deemed closed.
State presented closing arguments.
Defense presented closing arguments.


Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court is satisfied the defendant was not incustody (as defined by statute), at the time of the search.
Court also finds the defendant was not under any obligation to speak with law enforcement.
Everything indicates this was a consentual search.
Court Denies - Defense Motion to Suppress the Consent to Search.
Court Signed order.
All parties received a signed copy of the order in court.
